comments.text:
Hi Sian. Thanks so much for a great job! You've done justice to this 
selection of London's many fabulous and diverse shopping areas. We're 
really pleased to see people out there enjoying them too...
comments.author: Visit London

top_comment.text: I've been to all of them and it was really great!﻿
top_comment.author: Franzi Pond

comments.text:
+Visit London Camden!!! It is the place to go for a massive mix of 
everything. Also Borough market is great as well.
comments.author: britindianmakeup

comments.text:
Excellent. Any suggestions for areas we should have included? We're also

comments.author: Visit London

captions.text:
People visit London for all kinds of
reasons but one of the most enjoyable
has to be...
SHOPPING!
SHOPPING!
SHOPPING!
SHOPPING!

This video provides some handy tips on
the best places to visit for some fabulous
retail therapy
First up - Westfield London

A blend of high street names and designer
brands brought together under one family

friendly roof. So what you think Westfield
London is best for?

"The range of shops and the accessibility" 
"They have more shops in one place,

where you don't have to go so far to get
something that you want." "I think Westfield is

a good place to go because it's
like you can get whatever you want out here,
you got the luxury,
You got the high street, you know, you have sporty, casual, whatever you want!"
"New designs,
with anything new that's happening, it's always in Westfield"

Off to Knightsbridge in Chelsea, the place
where British fashion, beauty and culture
combine into a luxurious shopping heaven.
What do you think Knightsbridge is good for shopping-wise?
"The choice, like the range of shops that you have, even if you're not coming for clothes as well
there's like home ware as well, lots of different lifestyle bits and stuff
Zara, which is just over there so.."
"I go way back to 'Granny takes a trip' and stuff you know, when it was really quite something

but still very convenient people are
very nice!" "A variety,

there's just everything from all over the
world. There's normally a shop here that's
usually in another part of the world that you read about in magazines."
"Wander, get lost, explore, adventure"
Next, it's Oxford Street and Regents Street. With a host of sensational flag ship stores
and department stores

it's the home of affordable fashion."If you
really want to get to know, like, sort of like, Bristish
fashion
Oxford Circus is to place to come by"
"Start all the way at Tottenham Court Road and make your way down"
Where's your favourite place to shop in London? "Definitely it's got to be TopShop
We love TopShop, or Urban Outfitters"
"Probably TopShop
especially the flag ship one here". "Selfridges is the one to go for." "Selfridges, 100%"
"H&M, Zara." "Street style in London, you just like, look at everyone"
"There's inspiration literally everywhere isn't there?"

Nestled next door is Carnaby Street.
This iconic location is bursting with

high-end style and the latest street
fashion.
What do you think Carnaby Street is specifically best for?

"It's the most stylish street in London.
Its an iconic street in London
iconic street of the world.
You see how stylish people can be and what they can pull off and I'm always like 'wow'"

"There's such a variety of styles I mean
like shopping in brick lane
areas style really differs"
"Yeah, probably head somewhere like this like somewhere in the labels, obviously London is great for its labels.
It's a big fashion district like Paris and New York"
Say hello to Covent Garden, a truly historic
pedestrianised setting boasting an eclectic mix of fashion
and destination dining.
What do you think is the best thing about Covent Garden shopping? "The atmosphere"
"Covent Garden for me is for me the most British part of London"

"I like the fact that it's a
multicultural"
"In terms of clothes, you have everything, you have a lot of niche boutiques style shops
there's everything here so anything you want, it'll be here."
Rounding off our trip - Box Park

the pop-up capital of London oozing
cutting-edge designs and unique
quirky style
"Shoreditch is a really happening, it's the most happening spot in the world!"
"It's really vibrant, the shops here stay open later.You'll find things that you won't find in regular places and you just get to meet loads of people by shopping!"
"Shops, entertainment, restaurants, partying, having a good time,
this is where it's at"
"All people need to come here and check different places"
"Just go with an open mind because there are a lot of trends out and a lot of fashionistas out as well"
"This is where it's at! Shoreditch, Hoxton, look at it!"
For everything you need to know about shopping in London. Check out VisitLondon.com/Shop

title: London Shopping – A guide to the best areas
